title: We want in on Margot Robbie and Nicole Kidman’s crew as Bombshell stars continue friendfest
text:
We would very much like to be included in this narrative

Aussie actors Margot Robbie and Nicole Kidman are seemingly tight as anything, as the Bombshell stars continued to give us all the fomo.

After a photocall with their co-star Charlize Theron earlier this week, the duo took their friendshipfest to the Elle Women In Hollywood awards.

Being two women in Hollywood it was all very fitting, but we’re quite obsessed with their joyous display of BFF-ness.

Robbie and Kidman were dressed in head to toe black as they embraced on the similarly-noir carpet, holding hands for cameras.

Wearing a long blazer dress, Oscar winner Kidman beamed as she stood next to Robbie, as the world awaited their upcoming epic, based on the Fox News scandal.

Oh Nicole, you so funny (Picture: Rex Features)

Aussies in LA (Picture: REUTERS)

Oscar nominee Robbie was all about the aesthetic as she teamed her all-black ensemble with kohl-rimmed eyes.

She was on hand to support her co-star, who was of 10 women to be featured in Elle’s annual Women In Hollywood issue, gracing the cover alongside other champions in the industry.

Zendaya brought it (Picture: BACKGRID)

Gwyneth was also at the star-studded soiree (Picture: MediaPunch / BACKGRID)

They were joined by the likes of Gwyneth Paltrow, Scarlett Johansson and Zendaya who graced the star-studded event in Beverly Hills with their presence.

In Bombshell, Kidman plays real-life newscaster Gretchen Carlson, and Theron plays Megyn Kelly, who left Fox News in 2017 after the Roger Ailes scandal came to light.

Robbie plays a fictional character, Kayla Pospisil.

John Lithgow plays Roger Ailes and Connie Britton, Madeline Zima, Kate McKinnon and Robbie’s I, Tonya co-star, Allison Janney, are all stars in the upcoming film.

The film was directed by Jay Roach, who has two HBO movies examining political scandals under his belt, as well as 2012’s Game Change, about Sarah Palin being brought on as John McCain’s running mate in the 2008 presidential election.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ailes was Chairman and CEO of Fox News and Fox Television Stations, before unceremoniously resigning following allegations of sexual harassment made against him.

Written partly by Spotlight director Tom McCarthy, The Loudest Voice is based on the book by the same name, and stars Naomi Watts as former Fox anchorwoman Gretchen Carlson.

In August we were treated to a teaser of the film with Theron looking unrecognisable as formidable journalist Kelly.

The brief teaser showed the trio of Hollywood stars in a lift together; no words were spoken until the end, when Kidman’s character turned to the others and muttered: ‘Hot in here.’

We cannot wait!

Bombshell is expected in December 2019.
